reviewText:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BhMymxvErw4

The game revolves around you moving the camera to dodge the objects. That's about it really. The tutorial level is slow but then the real levels are real fast.

Positives:
+ Easy to learn, hard to master
+ Price is low
+ Abundance in Achievements
+ Leaderboards to compete with other people

Neutral:
~ Music is looped and the loops are short

Negatives:
- Bad spelling
- No colour-blind support (with the objects being red)
- Loses fun factor after a bit

The game was fun but then I found it lost its fun factor after 10 minutes. I would give it a neutral rating if I could, a negative would be harsh to the developer just because of no neutral rating on Steam. The game is okay but far from anything special or amazing.

For the price being low and if you feel slightly interested I would say go for it, I couldn’t recommend it to gamers looking for a deep game though or gamers looking for anything more than just a ‘Happy Birds’ type game where you fail often.

Saying that it did have the “Just one more try” effect on me. I attached a video to give you a better idea of the game. Thanks.

Linea is a simple, challenging and well-made game.

reviewText:
Linea, the Game is a minimalistic dodging action game akin to Super Hexagon. The premise of the gameplay comes from a series of red bars that move towards your screen, normally in one of the 4 directional positions (up, down, left, right). The object of the game is to dodge these red bars and survive for as long as possible. (60 seconds minimum to progress to the next level.) The gameplay is supplemented with minimialistic white and gray backgrounds, and fast-paced chiptune music.

Each stage has its own music track, so repetitive plays on the same level can cause the music to grow stale. The patterns for which objects appear don't seem too varied, so they become easier to pick up as the stage is repeated.

The difficulty ramps up as you progress through stages; the first few levels are relatively drawn out, enabling an understanding of the mechanics of the game. Once the player reaches stages 3 and 4, the tempo and difficulty increases. There is also currently a DLC pack with 3 extra stages and a bonus coin collecting stage, also with increasing the difficulty from the last stage of the game.

Overall, I was able to complete the game in one sitting. Replayability seems low, as the stages don't seem to increase in difficulty regardless of time. Those that are quite fond of these types of games are likely to have short play times as well, while newer members might find a challenge with the later stages. I was able to pick up both the game and DLC for 2 dollars, and received 1.5 hours of play time.

Will recommend for the low price of the bundle coupled with the quality of the game.

reviewText: Linea is a challenging reaction based game that’s sure to delight fans of the genre. The core game is fast paced with minimal downtime, ensuring that you’re not doing much else but bashing your head against the game’s primary challenge. The minimal visual aesthetic is great to look at but also a punishing part of the core game, making it that much more difficult to visually distinguish everything on screen. Whilst it might not be my usual cup of tea I was surprised I played it for as long as I did, especially when I started craving after a few achievements.\n\nRead my full review here: https://www.therefinedgeek.com.au/index.php/2016/01/15/linea-hesitation-will-be-your-end/
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Bought it for €0.99, 50% off of the current price (€1.99).

Firstly, no. Just no. I can't recommend this title at all, for the simple fact that the developer thought pricing it at €1.99 would even be reasonable. I've played mobile games on my Android that were better, in terms of content and play-ability and such games were either FREE, €0.99 or even €1.99. If I was the developer, I'd have priced the game at €0.99 maximum.

Secondly, I've been collecting the achievements and considering some of them are left to be hidden, I figured that they'd be tied to getting certain scores or maybe something even cooler... wrong. You're telling me that because I DIDN'T skip the tutorial at the beginning, I can't actually get one of the secret 'achievements' unless I delete my save data? No chance. I'd rather delete you from my games library and refund ya.

4 levels, 1 of them (the last one, oh noes) clearly just created to annoy the player, as opposed to fairly challenge them. If you're buying this game, wait until it drops to €0.50. It's not worth the price of admission at €0.99, unless you get lucky with the card drops.

Overall: Stay away from this title. It ain't worth your time. I've literally played through whatever was there and any of the additional time on the game is me sitting at the menu, tabbed, waiting for my final card drop.

reviewText:
The tutorial on Linea, the Game walks you though the game, telling you how to play and showing your 'hit box'.

You can use WASD, the arrow keys or a touch screen (Swiping gestures) to move left, right, up or down to avoid the objects on the screen. If you do not press anything, you will stay in the centre.

You have to avoid red" things for 60 seconds to win (You also have to dodge grey objects too).


Boktipset Från Helvetet

reviewText:
Simple idea yet addicting.
You dodge whatever comes in front of you.
There are just 4 levels excluding the dlc but i assure you, it will take multiple tries and raging to complete them.
The game would have lost its fun factor after few tries, if it weren't for the global leaderboard.
Now you have something to work on.
I say the price is right for the game.
The game runs smooth.
Gamepad recommended.

reviewText:
Linea, the game
Simple, difficult, good-looking runner.Features
Linea, the game will:
* torture your eyes
* ♥♥♥♥ your brain
* destroy your keyboard
* give a lot of fun
* give trading cards
Pros:
+ gameplay
+ soundtrack
+ graphics
+ fun while playing
+ price
Cons:
- should have more levels...
- and night / dark mode
Very nice game. 8+/10
